Package owltools Description

OWLTools - an OWL API wrapper

OWLTools is convenience java API and toolkit on top of the OWL API. It provides:

  • convenience methods for OBO-like properties such as synonyms, textual definitions, obsoletion, replaced_by
  • simple graph-like operations over ontologies
  • visualization using the QuickGO graphs libraries
  • A powerful command line interface that can be used to chain multiple operations

Projects using OWLTools

  • The Oort
  • TermGenie
  • OWLSim

Getting started:

  • The core model and API is in the package owltools.graph, the OWLGraphWrapper wraps an OWL Ontology
  • Graphical rendering is handled by the owltools.gfx package, see OWLGraphLayoutRenderer for QuickGO rendering
  • Input/Output for various formats is in the owltools.io package (not much there yet)
  • MIREOT-like support in the owltools.mooncat package (used in Oort)
  • Semantic similarity in owltools.sim
  • Phenolog analyses in owltools.phenolog

See Also:
The OWLTools Repository for more information
